snippet: Wendy Davis, the Texas state senator who filibustered abortion restrictions last year, told a Dallas newspaper she would have supported one restriction had it been written differently.
abstract: Texas gubernatorial candidate Wendy Davis, Democratic state senator who filibustered abortion restrictions in 2013, tells Dallas newspaper she would have supported one restriction--ban on abortions after 20 weeks of pregnancy--had bill been written differently.
lead_paragraph: Wendy Davis, the Texas state senator who filibustered abortion restrictions last year, told a Dallas newspaper she would have supported one restriction had it been written differently.

headline.main: Wendy Davis, Texas Candidate, Offers Nuance on Abortion View
headline.print_headline: Texas Candidate Offers Nuance on Abortion View
